flightclass package

Submodules

flightclass.flight module

This module contains a class for processing flight data, including downloading and parsing flight-related data and plotting flight routes.

class flightclass.flight.FlightData(*, url: str = 'https://gitlab.com/adpro1/adpro2024/-/raw/main/Files/flight_data.zip?inline=false', file: str = 'downloads/flight_data.zip', airlines_df: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], airplanes_df: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], airports_df: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], routes_df: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [])

Bases: BaseModel

A class for processing flight data, including downloading and parsing flight-related data and plotting flight routes.

arbitrary_types_allowed = True
aircraft_info(aircraft_name: str)

Print the specifications of a specific airplane model. Uses the airplanes_df attribute from the class and prints the specifications of the airplane model using the attribute Name from the dataframe. The method accesses ChatOpenAI to get the information about the airplane model.

Parameters:

  • self (FlightData) –

  • aircraft_name (str = the name of the airplane model) –

Returns:

aircraft_info

Return type:

A table of specifications about the airplane in Markdown.

Example

flight_data = FlightData() flight_data.aircraft_info(“Boeing 737-800”)

aircrafts() → list

Print the list of unique airplane models in the data. Uses the airplanes_df attribute from the class and prints the unique airplane models using the attribute Name from the dataframe.

Parameters:

self (FlightData) –

Returns:

unique_aircrafts – A list of unique airplane models.

Return type:

list

Example

flight_data = FlightData() flight_data.aircrafts()

airport_info(airport_name: str)

Print the specifications of a specific airport. Uses the airports_df attribute from the class and prints the specifications of the airport using the attribute Name from the dataframe. The method accesses ChatOpenAI to get the information about the airport.

Parameters:

  • airport_name (str = the name of the airport) –

Returns:

airport_info

Return type:

A table of specifications about the airport in Markdown.

Example

flight_data = FlightData() flight_data.airport_info(“Schiphol Airport”)

Print the list of unique airports in the data. Uses the airports_df attribute from the class and prints the unique airports using the attribute Name from the dataframe.

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

plot_airport_flights(airport_code: str, internal=False) → Map

Plots the flight routes from a specified airport on a map.

Parameters:

  • airport_code (str) – The IATA code of the airport to plot flights from.

  • internal (bool, optional) – Whether to only include flights within the same country.

Returns:

A map object with plotted flight routes.

Return type:

folium.Map

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified airport does not exist in the provided data.

plot_airports(country: str) → Map

Plots the airports from a specified country on a map using the Folium library. Utilizes the class’s DataFrame

Parameters:

country (str) – The name of the country to plot airports for.

Returns:

A map object with plotted airports.

Return type:

folium.Map

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified country does not exist in the provided data.

plot_country_flights(country_name: str, threshold: int = 1000, internal: bool = False, train_plane_ratio: float = 0.12) → Map

Plots the flight routes from all airports in a specified country on a map.

Parameters:

  • country_name (str) – The name of the country to plot flights for.

  • threshold (int, optional) – The distance threshold in kilometers to distinguish short-haul from long-haul flights.

  • internal (bool, optional) – Whether to only include flights within the same country.

  • train_plane_ratio (float, optional) – The ratio of train to plane emissions for short-haul flights.

Returns:

A map object with plotted flight routes.

Return type:

folium.Map

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified country does not exist in the provided data.

Notes

The train_plane_ratio is used to calculate the potential reduction in CO2 emissions if short-haul flights were replaced with train services. The default value of 3/25 is based on the average CO2 emissions per passenger-kilometer for trains and planes.

The map also includes a legend with the total distance and count of short-haul and long-haul flights, as well as the potential reduction in CO2 emissions.

The map is colored blue for short-haul flights and red for long-haul flights.

plot_top_models(countries: list = None, top_n: int = 10) → None

Plots the N most used airplane models by number of routes.

Parameters:

  • countries (list, optional) – A list of country names to filter the routes by.

  • top_n (int, optional) – The number of top airplane models to plot.

Return type:

None

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified country does not exist in the provided data.
